intro: Logania pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf logania, is a small, flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of delicate, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
